newsitem.title: USA: AUBREY LANSTON CHAIRMAN KELLY TO RETIRE AT YR END.
newsitem.headline: AUBREY LANSTON CHAIRMAN KELLY TO RETIRE AT YR END.

text.p: Richard Kelly, chairman of Aubrey G Lanston & Co will retire from active employment at the end of the year, the firm announced on Thursday.
Kelly, who joined Lanston in 1972 and became chairman in 1990, will continue as chairman of the board in a nonexecutive capacity, Lanston said.
William "Skip" Shaw will remain as the president and chief executive officer.

Kelly, whose expressed desire was to step down at age 55, is currently chairman on the Public Securities Association's Treasury Borrowing Advisory Committee. He has served the Treasury Department as a deputy assistant Secretary for debt management in 1978-1979 and was a member on the PSA Board of Directors.
Lanston is a primary dealer in Treasury securities and a U.S. affiliate of the Industrial Bank of Japan Ltd.
